history.content:
Last semester, 186 ran just like a normal course, except that all the lectures (along with the lecture quizzes) were on EdX.  There were still in-person discussions, office hours, etc.  I believe the plan is to do the same this semester.

(Don't have any advice for the second question though--someone else can chime in on that.)

children.subject: That's what I've heard too. You should take 61C to understand caches and how memory is managed on the stack. 186 relies on knowledge of caches and 161 relies on the latter.
Got it, thank you, I've dropped 161 and am taking 188 instead.
My advice would be to complete 61C before 161 as the first part of 161 relies heavily on C knowledge.

61c and 186 is a rough combination. Start your work the day of, because they overlap, and starting projects late for both classes is really really bad, since 1 little bug will ruin your program, and each project has many stages in which you can have a little bug. 186 OH is either empty or crazy full, usually full week a project is due.

and 186 is not an easy course at all, I’m not sure why that’s a stereotype.

history.content:
I'm a sophomore EECS student, and my schedule is currently CS 61C, 161, and 186. It appears as though CS 186 is going to be an online class this semester, and I was wondering if someone could tell me how those work at Berkeley, are lectures just going to be webcasted and everything done through bCourses, or is it something else? Thank you. 

Also, I heard that CS 186 and 161 are great for getting internships, so if anyone has any advice about that, that would be great as well. Thank you.
history.subject: CS 186 Web Class Spring 2019
